title: FireFox order of windows changes after reboot
content:
Hi!

My system:

Acer VERITON MN: VM4630G-i7477X 32GB Ram 256GB SSD program drive 1-TB HDD data drive Win10Pro 64-bit with Taskbar configuration manager "7+TaskbarTweaker" FireFox v 114.0.1 (64-bit)

Problem:

I normally keep five (5) (or more!) FireFox windows open with over 43 tabs between them.

Each window can have from 4 to 20 tabs.

Whenever I shutdown, reboot & restart FireFox the order of the FF-windows shown in the Taskbar is never the same.

Prior to shutting down I have ordered the FF-windows the way I want them, but upon rebooting and restarting FF the FF-windows are never in the same order.

What to do?

Is there a setting I've missed?

Thanks for any advice!
creator: JohnDohe

title: Funcions `loadOneTab` and `loadURI` in 2023 in Firefox Experimental API?
content:
I am using the Experimental API in my private Firefox extension.

So far, I've been using Firefox 102 ESR, but I'm planning to switch to Firefox ESR 115. There's already a Firefox 115 Beta available, so I've started testing it with my private extension.

So far, I've been using internal Firefox functions like `loadOneTab` and `loadURI` and it worked very well.

I used the `loadOneTab` function like this:

``` const placesURL = "chrome://browser/content/places/places.xhtml"; window.gBrowser.loadOneTab( placesURL, { inBackground: false, allowThirdPartyFixup : true, relatedToCurrent : true, triggeringPrincipal : services.scriptSecurityManager.getSystemPrincipal() } ); ```

But the `loadOneTab` function no longer exists at all in Firefox's internal API. What should I replace it with?

I found the function `_createTab`:

``` // window.gBrowser._createTab({ uriString: placesURL }); ```

But the `_createTab` function returns an error:

``` Uncaught Error: UserInteraction with id "browser.tabs.opening" was not initialized ```

...I guess this is by security to make this function called only by user action? And I call this function inside `async function`.

Is it somehow possible to open a new tab from the Experimental API in Firefox 115 beta? I need this very badly. Really very much.

---

I used the `loadURI` function like this:

``` window.gBrowser.selectedBrowser.loadURI(linkGo, {triggeringPrincipal: Services.scriptSecurityManager.getSystemPrincipal()}); ```

The `loadURI` function appears to still be available in Firefox's internal API, but returns an error like this:

``` TypeError: 'uri' member of CancelContentJSOptions is not an object. RemoteWebNavigation.sys.mjs:28:41 ```

How to overcome this error?
creator: look997

title: Windows 10 taskbar not appearing after Firefox 114.0.1 update
content:
I have my win10 taskbar on the left side of my screen, with auto-hide enabled. Never had any issue until the new update. When I start up Firefox (not in any full-screen mode) I pan my mouse to the left side of the screen and the taskbar no longer will show....Until i hit F11 to go full-screen and then hit F11 again to get out of it. Then the taskbar shows up as normal. Not sure why, nothing has been changed on my end since the last 4 or so updates and was fine until 114.0.1

Thanks.
creator: wickedmachine

title: Downloaded saved files get deleted after closing private browsing
content:
The only reason I'm making this question so that I can answer it and hope it helps someone else who is going through same problem.

If your pdf and image files are getting deleted after you close private browsing then simply go to settings and search download and a category called applications will appear which will show how different types of files gets handled.

Set the option to save file for all file types including image and pdf files. The problem should be solved
creator: hitaishi58
